intro: Teucrium ussuriense, commonly known as Siberian germander, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually violet or blue in color, arranged in dense terminal spikes. Teucrium ussuriense is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in well-drained soils.
